page.title: 13The Golf course
page.content: The Swindon golf course is an area of 5700 square metres. The course is a mixture of steep and gentle hills with rough ground for practice as well as smooth ground for playing golf.It has newly planted trees and lots of sandbunkers.Inside the club house there are rows of chairs and a television to watch. There is a bar.My dad is the steward, he sells the drinks. Karl's mum works in the restaurant,the food tastes lovely. There are about 5000 members and about 300 members come each day.To join the Swindon golf club it costs Â£150 for each year. Most members come from Swindon and a few come from Marlborough and Ogbourne St George.It employs 20 staff most of whom are local.
